Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 14, mean = 59, sd = 8.16 Sample 2: n = 19, mean = 36, sd = 8.98. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 74.75. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 33 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 14 and 19 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 31 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 33 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 14 and 19 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 31 degrees of freedom: Correct
